subject: Olympic Games
Track and Field
Awards, Decorations and Honors
Steroids
lead_paragraph: Athletes who finished behind Marion Jones, who returned the five medals she won at the 2000 Sydney Games after admitting to steroid use, will move up in order, the International Olympic Committee chief, Jacques Rogge, said. “We move them up,” Rogge said during a forum at a New York hotel. Rogge said top finishers down to five places were automatically tested by the I.O.C., along with three random finishers, and their results were stored for eight years so they would be cleared to be awarded medals.Jones won gold in the 100 meters, 200 meters and 4x400 meter relay in Sydney. She took bronze medals in the long jump and 4x100 meter relay.
